pages.title: Thank you for your interest in Sarah Lawrence College in Cuba

body.html:
Sarah Lawrence College in Havana

The Sarah Lawrence College in Havana program is highly selective and is open to juniors and seniors enrolled at any accredited American college or university. Students may apply for application in either the fall or spring. Each student takes four courses for a total of 15 credits. Course work includes Spanish at an advanced level, one core seminar on Cuban society and development, and electives in the humanities, social sciences, and the arts. From the beginning, the program's mission has been to expose American students to a culturally and politically unique society about which much has been written, but of which far less is widely known.

Learn more about this unique program at sarahlawrence.edu/cuba

body.alt: Image of people in carriage with vintage car in foreground with text "Havana"

pages.page_title: Study Abroad in Havana, Cuba with Sarah Lawrence College
pages.title: Study Abroad in Havana, Cuba with Sarah Lawrence College

body.html:
Study Abroad in Havana, Cuba with Sarah Lawrence College

Cuba’s influence on culture and politics has intrigued the world for many years. Yet, until very recently, this island nation had been off-limits to most Americans for two generations. Sarah Lawrence’s Study Abroad program in Havana has, since its beginning, aimed to expose American students to a culturally and politically unique society about which much has been written, but little is widely known.

From the program’s beginning, its mission has been to expose students at American universities to a culturally and politically unique society about which much has been written, but of which far less is widely known. As the longest continuously running study abroad program in Havana, it offers a small and intimate classroom experience as well as a full Spanish language immersion. These experiences promise a sense of authenticity influenced by Sarah Lawrence traditions and ideals.

The wealth of an education can be calculated by measuring the diversity of its parts. So the value of this Sarah Lawrence program can be found in the wide, creative range of the classes, seminars, fieldwork and site visits offered to its students. Enrollment is kept small intentionally so that faculty can devote individual attention to each student.

Terms: Fall and Spring

Credits: 15 per semester

Housing: All students live together in ANAP, a residence (casa de visita) belonging to the National Small Farmer’s Association (Asociación Nacional de Agricultores Pequeños). It’s centrally located in Vedado, one of Havana’s residential neighborhoods. Students can conveniently walk to the University of Havana, the Malecón and many cultural venues.

Language of Instruction: Spanish

Average Program Size: 12 to 15 students

Study Abroad in Havana, Cuba: Program Highlights

  • Small seminars
  • One-on-one meetings with professors
  • Study Abroad in Havana, Cuba concentrations include:
    • Social Sciences
    • Humanities
    • the Arts

Want to know more? Ready to apply? Please use the contact form on this page to take the next step on your journey to Havana with Sarah Lawrence College!

body.response_message: Thank you for submitting the form.

body.html:
Take the next step

Get more information on Sarah Lawrence in Havana.

“Sarah Lawrence meant…

finding a place where I didn’t have to call dance my “hobby.” Instead, Sarah Lawrence encourages me to pursue my two passions, dance and psychology, with rigor.”

Aishwarya Subramanian Class of 2017

“At Sarah Lawrence…

I found a school where I don’t have to choose. I am free to explore photography and writing. Being an artist isn’t confined to one thing and at Sarah Lawrence neither are you.”

Ally Powell Class of 2017

body.value: Loading...

body.html: But we want to hear from you.

“When I found Sarah Lawrence…

I found myself surrounded by people who share my drive to be independent and free thinking, in an academically rigorous environment. I found my people.”

Andrew Petrick Class of 2019

“At Sarah Lawrence…

I found a place where everything connects. Sarah Lawrence encourages unusual pairings like art and science. You can connect interests as surprising as forensic biology and video game programming. There’s always more than one way to do things.”

Kaili Aloupis Class of 2017

pages.name: Beijing
pages.page_title: Study Abroad in Beijing with Sarah Lawrence College
pages.title: Study Abroad in Beijing with Sarah Lawrence College

body.html:
Study Abroad in Beijing, China with Sarah Lawrence College

Sarah Lawrence College in Beijing is a new program offered in conjunction with the Alliance for Global Education. It is designed for students who have completed a minimum of one year of Chinese (Mandarin) at the college level, and wish to continue their studies in this major Chinese city. During this program, students will be immersed in Chinese language and customs while learning about contemporary culture through the arts, media and sociopolitical lenses. In addition to enrolling in a language course, a core course and electives, students may participate in an internship that will solidify the immersion experience. Students live with local families to allow for greater integration and a more gain an authentic experience of Chinese culture and improve their language skills.

Terms: Fall, Spring or Full-Year

Credits: 15 per semester

Housing: Students will spend the first two weeks of the semester in university housing, which will allow students to complete orientation together and become acquainted with their surroundings. After the initial two weeks, students will move into homestays.

Language of Instruction: English and Mandarin

Average Program Size:  12 to 15 students

Study Abroad in Beijing, China: Program Highlights

  • Small seminars
  • One-on-one meetings with professors
  • Courses include:

- Chinese language

- Core course in which students become familiar with China’s culture, philosophy, historical and social development

- Electives in foreign policy, filmmaking, visual arts

- Internships for credit

Want to know more? Ready to apply? Please use the contact form on this page to take the next step on your journey to Beijing with Sarah Lawrence College!
